title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 9.1 - Executive Order No. 1: Review, Continuation and Expiration of Prior Executive Orders
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 9.1 - Executive Order No. 1: Review, Continuation and Expiration of Prior Executive Orders

State Regulations
WHEREAS, an initial review has been completed of the

Executive Orders and amendments thereto that are in effect as of this
date; WHEREAS, it also has been determined that the Executive

Orders address ongoing issues and should be continued; and
WHEREAS, it is important to identify for the public those

Executive Orders that remain in effect and those that are no longer
valid; NOW, THEREFORE, I, KATHY HOCHUL, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and laws
of the State of New York, do hereby order that all Executive Orders issued by
previous Governors which are currently in effect shall remain in full force and
effect until October 8, 2021, unless otherwise revoked, superseded or modified; and
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the review of prior Executive

Orders shall continue over the next forty-five days to determine whether
additional orders should be revoked, superseded or modified. GIVEN under my hand and the Privy Seal of the State in the

City of Albany this 24
th
day of August in the year
two thousand twenty-one. Signed: Kathy Hochul

Dated: August 24, 2021

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
9.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
